Reviews.Title: “4 nights here”
Reviews.Author: Reeveew
Reviews.Content: First and foremost this was just used as somewhere to sleep for a hectic 4 night stay, it's easy to get to and convenient for the attractions, especially Disney. If you want a quality room/hotel, forget it, this is budget with a capital B. The room and whole ambience of the place were just that. I must have had the noisiest room in the place as well, by the door leading out from the dining area, lots of shouting and running kids from 6 am. One couple I spoke with had a quieter experience, 3rd floor at the end. Breakfast was a shambles with far too few tables for the number of diners. The pool for a decent size though and nice for a dip after a hot busy day. I paid about £170 for 4 nights B&B so it is fantastic value despite it's shortcomings. I just feel that given the competition in the area with tens of thousands of rooms available there will be better for not much more money. I do not plan on visiting the area again, but if I do return it will not be to this hotel. I've given it a 4/5 as it was so cheap and value for money, but unless price is your main criteria best avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Shaunda G
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed here on our vacation to Orlando. There were some issues with our check in and room assignment, but the staff quickly resolved the problems with our online reservations. The hotel is very close to Walt Disney World, and offers a nice breakfast daily. We would have no reservations with staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rysa0205
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical after reading some reviews but decided for the price we would try it..I have to say I had no complaints. The room was clean, the beds were by far some of the most comfortable we have slept in. The pool was clean, breakfast was free and good, they could use another waffle maker as the line was long for it. Yes there were a few bugs flying around, but come on people its florida, there are bugs everywhere. Location was perfect! I would definately book it!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty, dirty”
Reviews.Author: 4MD_3MA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was listed as "brand new." Bogus!! Very old and run down; lobby and room dirty; broken glass in the entry drive. Booked for a 5 night stay based on 4 1/2 star Trip Advisor review and "4.7 out of 5" Expedia review; no recourse on reservation - Quality Inn policy is that the traveler is responsible for 100% of reservation after checking in. You can do much better. This will be our last time with Quality Inns.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel with Bugs”
Reviews.Author: canduro
Reviews.Content: We had a cockroach in our room. The hotel is very dirty and run down. The breakfast and breakfast room is old and the food isn't good. The breakfast tables are dirty. The pool is not heated, it is so cold you cannot even swim in it. You'll be disappointed if you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Shake_N_Bake_13
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights over March break while we did the Disney parks. We really have no complaints. The rooms were average and the free breakfast was fine. The pool looked nice but we didn't get a chance to use it. The hotel was close to lots of restaurants, gas stations and various retail stores. The hotel is also close to all the Disney parks. Overall, it was a great value and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Heather E
Reviews.Content: My family (six adults and a four year old) stayed here when we for an eight day/seven night stay in two hotel rooms. We booked and pre-payed for our rooms through AAA's online service, and got a very decent price (around $50 a night). The staff here was very curtious.Our rooms were about average, not very spacious or big, but they were clean, which is very important. The Continental Breakfast got mixed reviews amongst my family. The guys (with their iron stomachs) seemed to enjoy it, while the women tended to stick to something "plain". Our first morning there, I opted to have one of the "make your own waffle" waffles, and oh, the tummy trouble that followed! After that morning, I opted to skip the breakfast. (Mind you, we stayed at two hotels our way down, both with the free breakfast, and neither one had bothered my tummy one bit). The pool was nice, and we liked that they had on-site coin operated washer and dryers (however, they have no change machine, and don't keep enough quarters on hand on the front desk to make change.) The machines are located on the second floor, where our rooms were, which was nice to not have to carry laundry up and down stairs on vacation. I would stay here again, but also might consider similiar priced hotels if they have better reviews. All in all, it was about an average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: Our room had what looked like blood stains on the sheets. The maintenance man came & took them away to wash them..they only had 1 set of sheets?! The bed was supposed to be a king size bed...however, it was barely a double. The bathroom door wouldn't shut w/o kicking it closed..the tv screen kept freezing up or rolling..impossible to watch. The refrigerator made a constant noise. The overall feeling was icky..didn't feel safe. Left and went to another hotel & got an awesome room for a few dollars more.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 2 star stay”
Reviews.Author: svnchipmunks
Reviews.Content: I chose this location based on previous reviews. We were arriving late from Disney, so we were concerned that we would get there and that there would be no room even with a reservation. I called ahead and they assured me that there would be no problem. We arrived at the hotel at about 10PM. Check-in took under five minutes and was thorough. I was informed of checkout time, complimentary continental breakfast, $200 charge if smoking in a non-smoking room and the $1 charge for using the in room safe, which I thought was odd. The room was very clean. It was nice to find it with a fridge and microwave. The bed was firm, but comfortable. It seems that some 2 star hotels use small square pillows now instead of the traditional rectangular ones. This was one of them. The pillows feel a little lumpy with cotton balls inside. Twice I woke up because of noise outside (people walking/talking) so I am not sure if the walls are a little thin or I just wasn't in a deep sleep. Other than that there were no issues with the room. I should have mentioned the pillows to the front desk. The breakfast room was packed at 9 AM, but it wasn’t a problem. We just had to be a little patient the one waffle iron. Breakfast included egg, sausage, waffle, white bagel/bread, warm danish, cereal and yogurt for the most part. Coffee and juices were also available. Check-out was fine. It was just as smooth as the check-in. Travel time to Disney main gate is no more than 10 minutes. Disney Animal Kingdom would be half that due to its proximity to the hotel. I also like the quick access to the Osceola Parkway from this hotel. Other than what I may think are slightly thin walls and lumpy pillows I enjoyed my stay. The staff was professional and courteous. I would definitely stay here again and think it was a good value for what was paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Rune R
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with my 19 y/o daughter. Arrived early in the morning before our room was ready but the receptionist was extremely helpful and accomodating and gave us our assigned room keys for later as well as offering to hold our bags in the staff office until we returned later that evening. We had stayed in a 'suite' hotel near Old Town for 3 previous nights and in comparison this feels much more a motel and from the outside appears to be rather lacking. Our first impression of the reception area was of all all pervading smell of disinfectant in a rather dim-lit area with a loud TV set, dingy elevator and a small eating area but the quality of service from the staff who were always happy to assist, completely overrides this, so don't be put off by first 'lobby' impressions, check out the room too. Our room was on the 3rd floor and was very clean and nicely presented. A large than usual mini-fridge enabled us to keep good supply of chilled drinks and there was a microwave and coffee maker too. Bathroom was very clean, our only quibble with it being that the towels were rather few and far between and also rather on the thin side. Also some kind of curtain separating the vanity sink area alcove from the main room would have been nice and afforded a little extra privacy when dressing / washing. Not such a problem when you have little kids or one couple staying but 2 couples sharing or a family with older kids would probably appreciate it. Beds were extremely comfortable, with sheets and comforters as opposed to blankets and we both slept very well and found it hard to get out of them in the morning! AC was a little on the noisy side but kept the rooms just right. Didn't use the shuttle service, pool or free breakfast so unable to comment on them, however we did use the internet. Connection was a little slow but it was also free so who's complaining. One point worth mentioning though - there was no ethernet (laptop to hub) cable in the room, we had luckily brought our own but it's worth checking with reception so you don't get caught out and unable to connect. Hotel is situated very close to the 192 and with a gas station mere seconds away. Plenty of good cheap eats around in various family restaurants, there's a supermarket close by plus a 24hr Walgreens across the 192 just a few mins down the road if you need milk, cereals, medicines, toiletries etc (oh and speaking of the latter, the hotel itself is happy to supply you with 'emergency' toothbrush etc if you arrive and find you've forgotten it!) Hotel is also very convenient for driving to the Disney Parks, we had a hire car and were parking up at the Magic Kingdom lot within 10 mins or so of leaving the hotel depending on volume of traffic. It's also easy to get up to I-Drive for Universal etc as well as other main routes. We stayed in Feb and it was very quiet so possibly it's noisier in peak season but even so all we really wanted was a place to sleep and this exceeded expectation. The option for an 'express check out' would have been welcome to allow for a quick getaway on that final day but even without this we weren't kept waiting too long. All in all, our stay here was pleasant and relaxed and we would certainly think of using this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: hersheyfanNy
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night because our timeshare started the next day but was amazed at how great the mattresss and pillows were - you had to practically climb to get in bed - check-in was fast and curtious - room had micro wave and frig. - best of all was the free wonderful continental breakfast in the morning from hot waffles, eggs, sausage to yogurt, cereal and fruit - it had everything. Will definitly stay there again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “If you're OK with cockroaches, it's great!”
Reviews.Author: Marie S
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we noted cockroaches outside our hotel room door (a first floor room). Not uncommon for Florida, but because the rooms have doors that led directly outside, we commented that we hoped that didn't mean cockroaches could easily access our rooms. When we opened the door, the first thing we saw was a giant cockroach on the wall. We immediately went back to the front desk and requested a room on a higher floor to reduce the chances of cockroaches. Even though we checked in late at night, he was able to accomodate us immediately and got us a third floor room. Sadly, no other compensation was offered. We scoured the second room for any sign of bed bugs, cockroaches, other unwelcome guests and found nothing. In our search though, we found that the rooms weren't cleaned very thoroughly (booger on the shower wall, trash under the mattress) but we were emotionally and physically exhausted at that point, so we took the bug free room and tried to sleep. Luckily, we had only booked one night at this hotel. We skipped the complementary breakfast. Once you see one cockroach, you can only imagine where the rest of them might be hiding, so we passed on the food that had been sitting out on the counter for three hours. Had we checked into that first room first, our ratings of this place would have been higher. But you can never get totally comfortable after a first impression like that. I know you get what you pay for, but earlier in the week, I stayed at a hotel that was triple the quality of this place (clean and cockroach free with many more accomodations) at the exact same price. I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice Hotels option near Disney so far”
Reviews.Author: KAF32082
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at this hotel in the past year. We first stayed here almost a year ago based on reviews. It is still the best Choice Hotels option that we have found so far near Disney. Our second stay was not great as our room had not been properly cleaned when we arrived (we complained about that stay and were comped one night). But this time it was clean and we had no complaints. Breakfast is not bad for a free breakfast including make-your-own waffles, bagels, some hot foods, fruit, yogurt, etc. For the price, this is still our #1 choice in the area. If you want to pay another 40-50$, there is probably something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Staff, But be careful if you have a pet....”
Reviews.Author: MarkATL
Reviews.Content: I satyed at this location last January and enjoyed the stay. I always travel with my small dog and pick hotels that are pet friendly. When I arrived at the property this Jan, the clerk advised me that she did have a room, but not a "pet friendly room"...this created a immediate problem, as it was almost midnight, I had been driving for hours, and had to find another hotel. As a Choice Privileges member, I feel that this should have been communicated on the Choice Hotels website when I booked the reservation. It was not. I allways confirm that I have a pet with me at registration at any hotel, and I must say that the clerk on duty was very polite, cancelling the reservation without penalty. Again, great Hotel, great rates, new rooms, but call the Hotel directly if you have a pet. Choice Hotlels left me (and my dog) without a place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and great value!”
Reviews.Author: sheryl88
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in Jan., 2012. This is not a luxury hotel, but very, nice, especially for the price we paid. The staff was wonderful--helpful, friendly. The breakfast included many options. Our room was very nice and clean. Our bed mattress was of good quality and firm and was covered with a down comforter; we slept very well. The hotel is only a short drive from the entrance to the Disney parks. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is not upscale, but we never felt unsafe. If we're ever back in Orlando, we would stay here again. The only negatives--pool is small, without jacuzzi and I didn't see evidence of a fitness center. However, we were in Orlando to visit theme parks, so we didn't miss those amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kimmita
Reviews.Content: This was better than expected. For $60 a night, a full breakfast (eggs, sausage, bagels, toast, yogurt, danishes, Frosted Flakes, raisin bran, do-it-yourself waffles, juice, coffee), updated room, cable TV with Disney channel, wifi, coffee maker, fridge, and even hand towels folded in a fancy shape to hold our toothbrushes-- wow! The staff was very friendly with every request. We didn't get to use the pool since the temps were in the 40s, but it looked nice. My advice to anyone hoping to use the shuttle-- don't bother. The schedule is not great--7:30a and 10a approx. to Epcot, then you have to take a ferry and tram. It took us a full hour and a half to get to Magic Kingdom. Then at the end of the night you can go back really early at 5:30p (approx.) or extremely late, around 10p. We were done at about 8, and with 3 little kids, decided to take a taxi. This cost us $20! Simply parking the car at the park costs $14, so that's what we did the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap price...closest to Disney, but won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: Ldm5
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Would not go back. Owners very nice. Probably closest cheap nationally known chain to the parks. As a single woman traveling....I would not stay here. Rooms cheaply remodeled. Many foreign guests. Many milling about in the parking lot. Room key never worked after 3 trips to front desk, arrived late, left early....never went in and out....so just gave up. Beds seemed small, but had great mattresses. One of the beds linens had "blood" stains. Elevator old. Safety features on it did not work. Breakfast ok. Over heard several others wondering how this hotel rates so highly on trip advisor. I have to agree. I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply worth it!”
Reviews.Author: DK2T
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through their website based on others' reviews. Well, they were right. This place is great! Everything from the service, comp toiletries, shuttles to the local attractions, and the cleanliness of the room is wonderful. Stay here, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Avery great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: DeeMack09
Reviews.Content: We stayed January 14-16th for a weekend stay and they were very accomadating. They told us up front that they a water main break and that they would have it fixed in a couple of hours. However they ran into some problems and they offered to put us up at the Clarion across the street but we had our pet and they did not except pets. They comp us a night and the water was back on at 7am. This place is VERY CLEAN. The owners are very nice and they have a great selection for free of a breakfast. We have stayed here before a couple of months ago and we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RamuduChennai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights. Its wonderful. Even though this is not luxury hotel, we enjoyed our stay and staff are excellent in providing right service on time. Breakfast has many options. Overall its good.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for theme parks”
Reviews.Author: jenny1966
Reviews.Content: Booked this back in May for the first leg of our christmas holiday to Orlando. Only two of us, got a ground floor room, two double beds, which were very comfortable, and changed daily. All room facilities were good, nice shower and wash area, with complementary toiletries and great coffee maker. Breakfast started at 6.30, very good selection of food available, including fresh fruit and yoghurts, plus unlimited coffee/tea. We had to rely on the courtesy shuttle service to Epcot, which had 2 departures, 7.30 and 11.15, once at Epcot, you could use the Disney transportation service (boat, monorail & bus) to the other theme parks. Pick up times were either 5.30 or 10 p.m. (Epcot) or 10.45 p.m. (Magic Kingdom) - only niggle was the fact that there were no other times, would have been nice to have more selection of times, as the shuttle stops at 2/3 other properties before Disney. No other complaints, very good value for money, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel FOR HEAVY SLEEPERS”
Reviews.Author: Rahrae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel after reading about it on Tripadvisor; for $89, we got a HUGE room, with two TVs, two double beds, and a sofa bed--as well as a frig, a bar, and a table. The room was very, very clean, but, unfortunately, it was also loud--the doors open to the outside, so there is more noise than usual from the highway, and, as someone has already aluded to, the A/C flicks on and off constantaly all night (there is no "fan on" setting). The people in the room above us were the icing on the cake--it sounded like they dribbled a basketball all night. (One of the kids, who had been on the sofa bed and had not heard our complaints, asked, "Why was someone dribbling a basketball at 2 AM?") The room was everything you could ask for in a Disney "base," the maid was attentive (though they ARE stingy with the soap--one bar for both tub and sink), the breakfast was satisfactory (the syrup is in those weird peeled-off-label bottles because the glass ones kept breaking, claims the attendant), the pool was clean, the Internet worked, the staff was kind, but we did not sleep for two nights, and therefore, sadly, we will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: sunshine02008
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in December 2011. Our room was very clean, The bed was comfortable. It is very convenient to Disney - almost at the entrance to the park. There are many restaurants and stores all along 192, and many of them are of walking distance from this motel. Our only complaint (minor as it is) is that they only put one tiny piece of soap in the room and you are supposed to share that soap between the sink and the shower with two people. I'm not sure why they are so stingy with the soap, but they need to put out more soap to save the guests from having to waste time and go to the front desk and ask for more. There is a free continental breakfast in the morning. Basic stuff - powdered eggs, sausage, danish. bagel, cereal and waffles. Coffee was empty one morning, and the tables were full two mornings. There aren't many places to sit in the breakfast area. But you can always take it back up to your room. There are two pools here. We didn't use the pool. There are shuttles to the theme parks, but we had a car so didn't use the shuttle. This is a very nice, clean motel that affords a comfortable night's stay for a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “clean and plain”
Reviews.Author: Pepperoni502
Reviews.Content: This was a clean ,inexpensive motel next to the main entrance to wdw. We enjoyed our stay in November of 2011. Very good barbecue joint across rt 192. Its called wildside.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent stay”
Reviews.Author: RicardoTerciote
Reviews.Content: It's an excellent hotel located 10 minutes from Disney Parks. Nice and kind staff, very confortable rooms and safe. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel, clean, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: ireland089
Reviews.Content: After searching online for an affordable hotel for our trip to Walt Disney I happened across this hotel in the Trip Advisor reviews section. We stayed at this hotel 8 nights and had a great stay. For a budget hotel it had everything we needed. The staff was friendly and pleasant, the room was clean and housekeeping did a great job of keeping it that way. The bed was comfortable, and the complimentary breakfast was not too bad either: eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, bagels, even fresh waffles, fruit, cereal. If you were in a hurry, or on a tight budget it was just what you needed. The location of the hotel is perfect. It took us roughly 10-12mins to get from the hotel to the Magic Kingdom parking lot. We visited in October so the traffic to WDW was very light. All in all we had a great stay, and I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephen A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights in Oct, the hotel is very clean it was cleaned everyday without fail,the beds are very comfortable, has friendly helpful staff, is very close to the Disney parks approx 7-8 mins and about 15 mins form Universal. However the rooms are basic and fairly small so we upgraded to a suite which gives you another room with a seating area and extra television and an area to make cold food i.e sandwiches etc. The pool was clean and the breakfast is OK it could benefit from a bit more variety but there is enough there to satisfy most people. Overall i would rate this hotel very good and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: MissPoppyHarriet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and were very pleased with the hotel. It had everything you needed in the room and the price per night was very good and included a buffet breakfast (waffles, sausage, egg, Biscuits, fruit, cereal, Bagels,mini cakes etc.). The room was very clean and the location was excellent, near plenty of restaurants, shops and not far from Disney. The only thing I would note is that if you are a light sleeper this hotel is just off the main road so you can hear the noise of the traffic. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Good but not totally perfect"”
Reviews.Author: chillywillypenquin
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast assortment; washer not working - clerk told us to go on computer to find another laundry facility - no sign on machine- end up front desk manager was contacted - informed us machines was full of coins - not emptied out causing malfunction of washer, front desk manager was very prompt in refunding our money for the washer problem; bug problem at front door, since our room was on the first floor - management came to spray and resolved the problem within 5 minutes. Overall, the lodging was a very good experience; however, if you go in the hot summer expect carpenter ants when staying on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Jellybean641
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel at a VERY reasonable price- I've been very pleased with our experience! The staff is welcoming and even let us check in early after a long drive. the room is clean- no complaints at all! The breakfast had sausage, eggs, gravy, yogurt, waffles, and bagels. Perfect for the price- great location for those going to the theme parks. I was a bit frustrated with the food/shopping around- not much more than the typical tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: 73duster
Reviews.Content: We were looking for hotel close to the parks, with free internet and free breakfast buffet. This one fits the bill perfectly. Excellent location with lots of restaurants and stores nearby ( including Target, 5 min drive). Very close to Disney Animal Kindom - 10 min drive. Breakfast buffet wasn't bad (waffles, sausages, eggs, yogurts, cereal, muffins, toasts ..). Internet connection was excellent. A/c was noisy (as in most hotel rooms). They have washing machine and dryer, cost around $ 5-6, including detergent. Fresh copy of Wall Street Journal every morning at the reception desk, which I love to read. Don't go to Angel's seafood buffet - horribly overpriced, considering selection and food quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mi4Sons
Reviews.Content: I use trip adviser to review any property that I'm considering and once again the reviews for this hotel were accurate. My priority is always "clean and safe". We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights from September 17 to Sept. 22/2011 and then again from Sept 26 to Oct 1. The room was spacious and clean. When first entering the room there was a slight musty smell but we also experienced that smell in our rental vehicle when we first got it. I'm assuming this is typical with the high humidity in Florida. The typical daily temp. while we were there was 90. This hotel is very convienient to the Disneyworld. parks. After driving down to Key West area we decided to come back early and spend more time in Orlanda so decided to stay again at this hotel. I had some issues with booking(my fault - make sure you choose the right Quality Inn as there are a couple on the same street) but Mike, behind the front desk was so extremely helpful in sorting this all out. Our second stay in the hotel was wonderful with the bonus of no musty smell in our room. Our room was exceptionally clean and continued to be for the whole time we were there. The gal responsible for the daily breakfast constantly keeps her eye on things to be sure there is enough for everyone. The swimming pool was refreshing and very clean. This hotel is an excellent choice and the staff are doing a fabulous job in meeting the needs of their guests. We would definitely book here again if we're ever in the Orlando area. Thanks to all the staff at the Quality Inn and again specifically, Mike!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and People”
Reviews.Author: TJ W
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel for a good price. The people were extremely helpful and friendly. Easy to get to/from airport and Universal. Close to several restaurants. Only complaint I can think of is not enough towel bars in the bathroom. The breakfast was average but ample, and what was expected for standard "free" breakfast fare.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SarahC73
Reviews.Content: Not much to say about this hotel, as it's excellent in every way, could not find fault with anything. The staff were absolutely lovely people, always there to help. The room was clean and tidy, extremely comfortable bed got made every day, along with fresh towels. The grounds were tidy and well kept. Free daily breakfast (which we didn't get round to using), complimentary shuttle services to the parks, always on time with very pleasant friendly drivers. Supermarket directly outside, which was very convenient. If we ever return to Kissimmee, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shamrockrv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, safe, and priced right. Best Kept Secret in Orlando area. The front desk staff were extremely helpful, and friendly. The breakfast was more than adequate. They are most accommodating. The amenities, especially the free shuttle to epcot are appreciated. We will be staying there every time we are in Orlando. Thank you for an especially enjoyable stay. Recommend you stay here if you are planning on visiting any of the theme parks in the area.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel with bad smell”
Reviews.Author: A B
Reviews.Content: Positives: The hotel is quite cheap and clean. It has a convenient shuttle service to Disney World, Universal Studios and Seaworld, though there are not a lot of times to choose from so it can be a challenge to plan your day around the shuttle times. The breakfast was better than expected, with eggs, sausage, cinnamon rolls, and DIY waffles. No resort fees -- check for these when you're booking; a lot of hotels in the area have a "resort fee" of up to $12-15 per night that doesn't show up on their rate. Negatives: The room that we stayed in had a really bad smell (even though our room was non-smoking). Also be advised that the rooms open to the outside rather than to an interior hallway. This leads to a bit more noise and there were a lot of bugs all around the door to our room (and all the rooms). The bugs were everywhere, that wasn't their fault, but if the doors opened inside it wouldn't be a problem. We only saw a couple of bugs inside the room. The maid also took away a couple of convenience items (the remote, which was switched for a beat-up one with no battery cover, and the box of kleenex) and didn't replace them while we were there. Overall we were satisfied. It was very easy to drive to Disney and Seaworld from this hotel. The room was pretty nice in terms of the tile in the bathroom area and pretty comfortable beds. We would recommend the place if you can handle the smell.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and close to Walt Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Norway86
Reviews.Content: Motel rooms were clean and comfortable, the beds were big enough for us. Very helpful and friendly staff, they could answer every question. We felt that we stayed in a safe, professional establishment. Not so much to do in the area around the hotel, but plenty of eateries in walking distance. The breakfast was simple, but filling. The main reason for choosing this hotel was the complimentary theme park transportation, and we were pleased that the shuttles were clean, rather fast and had very friendly drivers. If you want a cheap and clean Motel close to WDW, choose for this one!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, clean & modern Motel/Hotel with free breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Andimal
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were very clean & modern, double beds were quite small though, staff were very friendly & helpful, free buffet breakfast was better than most free breakfasts (hot items were sausage patties, scrambled egg patties, French toast sticks, make your own waffles & a toaster for brown & white bread & bagels), only 1 waffle iron meant a long queue some mornings to make your own waffle.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the bucks, even more!”
Reviews.Author: Mark G
Reviews.Content: Me and my gf went there for 2 weeks to visit central florida, disney world and universal studio, it's near everything and this hotel is really great! Clean and good looking rooms, free breakfasts!!! shuttles and a nice pool to chill after a long day!! The staff is also very friendly! I was almost ashamed for paying such a low price for those two weeks lol A1!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal!”
Reviews.Author: r_j_scanlon
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms for a total of 12 nights (3 nights each). The hotel is clean, good sized rooms, great continental breakfast and courteous staff. Add in the price and it was a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights from 4th August. Friendly and courteous staff. Clean rooms. Convenient to Disney parks. Clean pool area. FREE breakfast which was tasty. Really comfy beds. FREE parking. Close to a wide range of restaurants. Would recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, Good Price, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: redlandfd
Reviews.Content: We chose this motel based on tripadvisor reviews and the price. Both were right on the mark. It was a clean, well run motel; good breakfast; the front desk was very helpful and friendly. We checked in early and was able to upgrade for no additional cost since we were staying for the week. The beds are doubles not queens so it might be a tight fit for two grown adults. Good bathroom, good pool, close to several restaurants, quick drive to Disney; easy access to the turnpikes for driving to Orlando or Cocoa Beach. We paid $60 a night.

Reviews.Title: “"Great accommodation for the price"”
Reviews.Author: guylove62
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean Front desk was prompt in satisfying guest requests Continendal breakfast - superb - couldn't ask for more Definitely, will be back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: anna632
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in. Everything was just perfect. I took my Granddaughter to Disney for 2 weeks and this was her first experience. I realize that I have spoiled her, but the experience at the Quality inn made the trip more wonderful. The service was exemplary, and the ambiance perfect. The location was very central for walking and other conveniences. I could not have asked for anything more. It seemed that the entire staff anticipated your every need and then followed through. Just wonderful!!!! Special thanks to Harry.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and clean for a single mom and toddler.”
Reviews.Author: CAKJ2818
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reviews. When I pulled up, I thought "What did I do?" It looks like a cheap motel from the outside. When I got in the lobby, though, it was pristine and very nice looking. To say the staff was polite is an understatement. I was traveling by myself (20-something single mom) with my toddler and the gentleman at the desk said right away "I have you on the 3rd floor. Let me find something closer for you." He gave me a room on the first floor right up front so I didn't have to lug the baby and all of our stuff up three flights! The room was spacious and clean and the bed was comfy. I didn't hear any traffic noise, the only thing I heard was the squeaky door from the next room. Not so bad. I felt safe, there were lights in the parking lot and outside my room, the window shades covered everything completely, and there was no "suspicious" activity or people hanging around. The free breakfast had the normal eggs, sausage, waffles, coffee, juice, etc. It wasn't crowed and the lady kept everything refilled and hot. There were even some highchairs for the little one. The hotel is minutes from Disney, too. It isn't a fancy resort if that's what you're looking for, but for the money, my expectations were exceeded. I'd return - it isn't easy to find safe, clean, and affordable all in one place!

Reviews.Title: “Great - would def stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Caroline270965
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as last 2 weeks of a 3 week holiday. Got suite for $60 a night - 2 rooms - one with 2 double deds/TV and bathroom and second room had bed seetee/bathrrom/TV/Dining table and fridge and microwave. Rooms large and clean - pool OK - Free tea/Coffee all time and free breakfast in mornings - they also do not mind you bringing the breakfast to your room - my husband went every morning and brought a huge tray of food to our room About 2 miles from old town - mile marker 11 - 20 mins from International drive and 10 from Disney

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT !!! THANK - YOU!!!”
Reviews.Author: BallyclareJoe
Reviews.Content: Guys As previous posts have stated, this is a cracking wee hotel, right on the door step of all you need. It is located on mile marker 3, minutes from disney, universal and within walking distance of loads of restaurants. The staff/owners are fantastic, really friendly and truly do want you to enjoy staying at their hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean, the beds, we thought, where sooo comfortable and the maids completed room service everyday - THANK-YOU !!. The inclusive breakfast, had a good selection to get anybody started, it was continualy replenished - great, really good !!!. Another way to look at it is, if there are 4 of you staying, and you decide to eat out for breakfast, it's going to cost you around $10each person, each morning (app $6 for breakfast, $2 for a drink, your tax and then tip - comes to around $10 each), thats approx $40 each day X 14 days = $560 saved !!! The last 4 times that we have been to the States, we have hired a villla, in this hotel we had one of their suites and to be honest, if given the choice, I would take this hotel everytime. Great Hotel !! Great Location !! Great Staff !! Great Owners !!! Thank- You !!! joe (Watson Family - Ballyclare)

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: KCtraveler53
Reviews.Content: A clean, economical, renovated hotel with a friendly staff and a great location. It's a family-run operation, and they try to make sure their customers are happy. The beds are very comfortable. Also, a hot breakfast is included in the price. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a budget concious Disney trip”
Reviews.Author: Ramtrucker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for a quick Disney trip. Booked because of the value and rating on tripadvisor. Very nice desk staff, nice lobby, building in general had a nice upkeep feel to it. We stayed on the 3rd floor, ice was only available on the 2nd floor and had to walk a bit to get to it. 2 double beds,I would have preferred queens, maybe it was an option but not sure. Overall the room was a basic hotel feel, bath area had been updated this decade with dark ceramic tile walls and a bowed out shower curtain rod. Easy in and out of the parking lot and access to 192. Pool was small and fair. Had some noisy neighbors at around 10pm, seemed they thought it was ok to talk from 3rd floor down to parking lot for 20 minutes. I couldnt understand them anyway. Breakfast was sort of a mess, its like scrambled egg disks, weird lookin sausage and some cereals and small pastries, I didnt eat any. Plus it was really crowded. Average daily price was $60, and it was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value and Service!”
Reviews.Author: DeacsinPanthers
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here while visiting the Disney Parks. We usually stay on site at the value resorts but the price was pretty high for this time of year and we were on a more strict budget. The location is great. It is about 5 minutes to Magic Kingdom and very, very easy to get to. The hotel is located just off a main road that has lots of stores and eateries. We got a great rate. The lobby area was attractive with 2 computers, a tv, couches, bathrooms, and a breakfast area. Once we checked in we found our room to be updated and in great condition. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was nice too. We took advantage of the free breakfast. It was wonderful! They had lots of breads (bagels, english muffins, bread, pastries), hard boiled eggs, waffle machine, french toast sticks, eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit, sausage, juices, and coffee. We did not take advantage of the free transportation to parks because we wanted to leave mid day for a break. They do have a schedule at the front desk though. On our mid day break we took advantage of the large warm pool. It was clean and refreshing. Our son loved that he could stand in the 3 foot area! Overall we had a wonderful stay! We will definately stay here again for future visits to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch facility!”
Reviews.Author: GwenP
Reviews.Content: After reviewing the hotel/motel choices on Tripadvisor prior to our trip to Orlando. we chose this motel based upon the good reviews and reasonable rates. We weren't disappointed. The owners have taken great pride in remodeling the rooms and the facility as well as ensuring that their customers are happy. It appears that it's completely run by family. The rooms look just like the ones shown on their website - roomy, crystal clean and warm/inviting. The colors are rich and vibrant - certainly much nicer than your average motel room. We asked for a quiet room on the third floor and that's exactly what we got. We never heard a peep from traffic or from other guests. Unlike many other motels, this one has your usual outside stairs, but it also has an elevator. This was wonderful when it came to not having to lug our stuff up three flights of stairs to our room, yet allowed us to park close to the stairwell near our room. They offered a free hot breakfast which was average. There was a nice selection and for free, what can you expect? It was perfectly located to the Disney parks - only about a ten minute drive away. We paid $63/night with our AAA discount which was a down right bargin. This is well maintained and managed facility that I would recommend to anyone. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because we had a problem with a discount ticket agency that they have on their premise. Though it is independently owned and operated and not affiliated with the hotel, it still reflects poorly on the hotel. We paid $20 to "hold" four one day tickets to Magic Kingdom for the following day. We were told to stop by the office at 8am the following morning and we would be given the tickets as well as someone would accompany us to the park to make sure we didn't have any problems getting in. 8 am rolled around and no show. 8:20 rolled around and no show. My husband called and was told that they were running late and would be there in 15 minutes. At 8:45 they still weren't there, but were told they'd be there with the tickets in 15 minutes. At 9:15 when they still weren't there and were told that they'd be there in 15 minutes, we gave up and went to the park - losing our $20. The front desk appeared quite upset about the situation and also informed us that two other people were waiting for their tickets too. They made some calls, but it didn't seem to matter. We're not sure if the ticket guy ever showed up or not. The next morning, nobody was in the ticket office to complain to and get our money back by the time we had to leave. This is really an unfortunate situation. The hotel is well run, but it certainly reflects poorly on them.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, awesome pricing”
Reviews.Author: solarstar
Reviews.Content: The positive reviews for this site are well deserved. While it doesn't look like much from the street, the rooms were clean with mini-fridges and microwaves. The pool was also kept clean, and the housekeeping staff stayed on top of things. The location is near many restaurants and shops that were a short drive away. The staff was very friendly and anxious to be helpful. The breakfast buffet had the basics (waffle maker, sausage, cereal, bagels, etc.) with enough to keep the kids happy. We stayed here with a sports team and weren't disappointed. (We found the best prices at the Quality Inn website.)

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: Gluu
Reviews.Content: Very average chain motel. Clean, complimentary breakfast (like most of chain motels - not very good), fridge in the room, free wifi, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: sascha07
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating a birthday and the staff was very accomodating. The owners are friendly, efficient, and very quick to please. The housekeeper Jenny is a gem. She works very hard and always has a smile. The breakfast offers alot to choose from and everythig is clean. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING Hotel and Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: Barry57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, affordable and the people that work there are the friendliest and most accommodating you will find. They have some pet rooms that are fully tiled for folks that have pets. Animal Kingdom Lodge is just 2 miles down the road and costs hundreds of dollars more. And they provide FREE WIFI. This is a great value. Room includes a great breakfast as well. The hotel is clean and well run. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not great this time”
Reviews.Author: KAF32082
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of months ago and it was the best we had found in the Choice Hotels options near Disney, so we stayed again. This time it was not so great. When we got to our room there was no soap, shampoo, cups, tissues, and less than half a roll of toilet paper. The refrigerator and coffee maker had not been cleaned out. The freezer was not functioning. Two cockroaches in the room. We complained and they took one night off our bill. We will probably try again, but one more bad experience and that is the end.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Hotel is "OK".”
Reviews.Author: Paige76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because our usual place was booked. It is a rather small hotel. The front desk attendants during check-in were very nice and friendly. When we got to our room we realized they upgraded us to a room with a refrigerator and microwave - which was nice, but it was a handicapped accessible room....meaning the bathroom was huge, no tub, but rather a shower (that was a bit of an issue for my 2 year old.) On our first night there, a rather large spider crawled/leaped (who knows) onto my fiancees head and it wasnt a daddy long legs, either! The flat sheets smelled clean but had greyish stains on them. The next day, my son spotted a trail of five other smaller spiders on the curtain and the top of the TV had a thick film of dust on it. As far as breakfast goes...they serve until 9:30 AM and they do start picking up at close time. They have a good selection (muffins, toast, pastries, eggs, sausage patties, cereal, yogurt, and they have a waffle maker - which is pretty nice, juice and coffee). They have ample seating, but if it gets to crowded you wont have a place to sit, which happened to us one of the days. We had a pretty positive breakfast experience overall. The pool is not kept clean, you can see the thin grey film of dirt around the floor and walls of the pool. Definitely not a pool to go in. The location is excellent, we were a 5 minute (if that) drive from Animal Kingdom and a few minutes further from Disneys Hollywood Studios. There are restaurants close by (Cracker Barrel, Perkins, a seafood restaurant - forgot the name, etc.) The location really could not be beat. On our last day, we got locked out of our room at 8:30 AM, the keycard apparently had been deactivated despite that we had not checked out yet. I called front desk and they had me walk over there to get another card as if I wasnt inconvinienced enough. Overall, the stay was do-able. But I'm not sure I'd stay here again. I've stayed at way bad hotels, and great hotels...this one is inbetween. Perhaps, they just need to get some sort of pest company to come fumigate on a regular basis, get a pool cleaning service and dump stained sheets. ;) Pros: Location, Breakfast and friendliness of front desk. Cons: Spiders, stained sheets, dirty pool, locked out key issue.

Reviews.Title: “worried for nothing”
Reviews.Author: sharkieteal
Reviews.Content: i stayed here from 26 april-3may. im used of staying in big fancy *****-hotels but due to circumstances i had to look for a cheaper hotel. this was one of the cheapest hotels available. I was worried about the quality and had my bug spray packed. my flight was delayed so i arrived after midnight. i was a little worried if id be safe, as a lady travelling alone. they must have noticed at the reception desk and showed me a quick safe way to my room. all the worries were for nothing. it was a safe neighbourhood, rooms were clean and bug-free. breakfast was excellent. several types of bread, egss, sausages, fresh pancakes, fruitjuices, coffee, tea, cereals,... also the room had a fridge, microwave, coffemachine. and icemachine and softdrinkdispenser were in the hallway. i had to go to an event at the espn world wide of sports in disney which was easily accesable, just like all the other parks. near the hotel are several fast food chains and shops. close by some shopping malls. though id recommend a rental car. pool was small but clean. hotel had only 2 floors but there was an elevator. the lady from housekeeping was busy allday going from room to room with a smile and kept the room very clean. lots of towels available in the room. free parking. although its situated close to some big roads, the room was very quiet. nice beds, somewhat small pillows. another negative point was the light. room was kinda dark unless youd keep the curtains open. windows couldnt be opened. friendly staff at the reception. overall an excellent hotel for its price. dont except big luxurious rooms, but its great quality for its price.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: ParkvilleJB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (mid-forties) and our 8 year old stayed here for 10 days April 19-29, 2011 and look forward to going back again. I am a Choice Privileges member and scouted over 40 Choice hotels in the area plus some others. This hotel was the clear overall choice in terms of location, pool, room size and the reviews I had read (including "If you don't stay here, you're an idiot! LOL) . I don't write reviews often but felt I should in this case. I had a few questions including ADA rooms so I called and Jim answered. Within 5 minutes he had answered all my questions and made special arrangements to make our stay perfect. Everything in our room (a suite) was exactly like in the pictures. and the maid service was excellent. She cleaned and replaced everything while also working around all of our stuff - quite the task because we had things everywhere! Outside was hot but the room was chilly so we turned off the AC at night. When we'd return from the parks, the maid had turned it back on for us. The pool was crystal clear, the breakfast was better than any other Choice hotel we have stayed at and the location was excellent. Note: Learn the Sherberth Rd way to Disney parks before you arrive. Entry Point becomes Sherberth on the other side of 192. A local I met referred to it as the hidden 5th exit into Disney and it is a big time saver when traffic is bad. We even used it returning from Universal because I-4 and 192 were jammed. We got off I-4 heading to Magic Kingdom and then to Sherberth. The place is clean, the staff is friendly and the location is great. If you are looking for an economical place without any concerns, this is it. Free Wi-Fi!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Disney and Universal”
Reviews.Author: NAUgrad2005
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at this hotel, and it's been a good stay so far. The room is on the third floor, but they do have an elevator which made getting our bags to the room very easy. Beds are super tall, fairly comfortable with decent linens. I do wish that there was a blanket on the bed, but the duvet is sufficient. I LOVE that the hotel has free WiFi and parking, as well as a breakfast buffet. I took the free shuttle to Universal today, and I'm hesitant to recommend it. The shuttle is operated by Platinum Transportation, and they picked everyone up at 0730 this morning. After stopping at several other hotels and Seaworld, I was dropped off at Universal around 0815. The park was surprisingly quiet and I was ready to head back to the hotel at 1330. When I called the hotel to be picked up, I was told that the contracted shuttle would only pickup at 1800 when the park closed. I inquired about a taxi, but was quoted $30-40 to get from Universal to the hotel. I ended aup waiting for the 1800 shuttle, and after all stops were complete, it was 1930 before we got back to the Quality Inn. So, if you think you'll be done early, drive your own car or be prepared for an expensive cab ride. It would be nice if the hotel would provide an afternoon shuttle. All in all, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: USAtravellerNebraska
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel in a safe area; close to Animal Kingdom, lots of restaurants nearby. Very clean room, good breakfast, exceptionally friendly staff. Excellent value for money overall and highly recommended for a long stay. I shan't even trouble to look elsewhere when visiting the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap and great Value”
Reviews.Author: Skygem
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and even though it is rated within the top 10 I believe that this is very good for the price. The people who worked there were all very friendly and willing to answer any questions. The biggest thing going was the coffee that they had 24 hours a day. NOT YOUR TYPICAL BROWN COLORED water, this was coffee with taste. The breakfast has scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles and french toast sticks. Biscuits and gravy on weekends. Some of the biscuits were hard but pretty good overall. Everyone was full when we went to the park. Plenty of restaurants even within walking distance. Only 1 1/2 miles from Disney ramp. Even though it's an older hotel you can tell that the owners are putting money into it to upgrade. The bed was really comfortable. I would stay there again, like I said the value was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: chigsmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week in March while visiting the Disney Parks. The location was perfect for getting to the parks easily. The rooms were a good size for our family of 4 and nice and quiet. We started each day with a good breakfast and ended most days in the pool. The staff was wonderful and printed out maps and coupons for other attractions in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, FIRM beds.”
Reviews.Author: irishzim
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean and quit rooms, heated pool, nice breakfast (eggs, sausage, waffles, fruit, etc). Very close to Disney parks, food marts, and restaurants. I've never been in a double bed before and will not again - this is too small for two adults. Also, I am not used to firm mattresses, theirs are as firm as they get. A great place for folks who like firm beds - and do not need space for two adults to a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean no frills - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: traildawgz
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed in a Hotel/Motel in many years...but being on a budget this time and relatively last minute...why not. OK no frills and I mean none lol. But clean, well maintained and very friendly staff. Seems like a family run business and they take pride in how they manage the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: lis137
Reviews.Content: Great location! When we arrived, the manager upgraded our reservation to a room with a refrigerator and microwave. What a nice welcome! The hotel was very close to Magic Kingdom and Epcot. We had no trouble getting there. They had a shuttle but it ran infrequently and not directly to Magic Kingdom. They dropped you at Epcot and expected you to use Disney shuttles to get where you are going. If you,like us, want to open and close the parks, you need to drive. The chambermaid service was undependable. We would be gone from 8-2 and return to an unmade room. They had no way of showing that you wanted the room to be made up. One day (of the 4) we didn't have service at all, but it's not like we are used to someone cleaning our house everyday. Not a huge deal. The breakfast was above average. They had plenty of food and plenty of seating. The coffee in the lobby had real half and half and was available at all hours. The staff was friendly and someone was always present at the desk. The location was in the middle of many chain restaurants. We walked to dinner each night. This hotel was a good inexpensive choice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this place”
Reviews.Author: sally 21
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find a very polite and happy guy named Jim on the front desk. There was a problem with our booking but Jim sorted it out within minutes putting us in a suite until our room became available ( we didn't know that it was spring break and the hotel was full ) The suite was a great size and recently refurbished ( as had all the rooms ) We had everything you could need. Comfy beds, great shower, tv's, microwave and fridge. The breakfast was an added bonus.Plenty for you to choose from including, sausage, patties, eggs, waffles,yoghurt, toast,muffins,pastries, and even though the hotel was busy there was always lots to eat as it was constantly being topped up.No complains on the breakfast score. Half way through our break Jim told us that our room was ready and asked politly if it was ok if we moved as the suite was booked out for the next few days. We were happy to do so as we hadn't booked a suite and just had to move upstairs. Once again the room was immaculate and newly decorated, with microwave and fridge.House keeping came every day and left loads of fresh towels. We also met Mike on the desk, who just like Jim was helpful, polite and happy. The guys here really do take customer service and satisfaction very seriously and we didn't find fault with any part of our stay. great location, great hotel,great price, great staff - what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: tpinder6
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this Motel highly enough, Jim the owner and all his team were first class and deserve much success, nothing was too much trouble for them.the motel is perfectly located for all the Disney locations including Downtown Disney if you want to check in with Virgin less than 10 mins away. The rooms are very clean, the breakfast is better than any motel breakfast wev'e ever had before and we were allowed a late checkout at no extra cost even though they had a reservation for the room for that night, altogether a great stay

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hitech72
Reviews.Content: For those of you who love the Disney Theme Parks but can't quite afford to stay at the Disney resorts, let me tell you of a family run Quality Inn and Suites Hotel west of US Hwy 4 off of 192 to Entry Point Boulevard. This hotel has been completely refurbished and also serves a wonderful breakfast every morning allowing you to get to the theme parks well in advance of park openings. The maid service is excellent, the maintenance man is a wizard at fixing or replacing things.The management team consist of three brothers covering all three shifts. You really should give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to stay in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: 2inlove74
Reviews.Content: This was the best place we have ever stayed in in the Orlando area. The room was large and very clean, the beds were very comfy. the location was great and the value could not be beat. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast which is included in the room price was great. We have traveled to the Orlando area often as we have family there and this was the best place we have ever stayed in. It is very close to Disneyworld and near the other attractions as well. There are numerous restaurants and shops within walking distance and many more within a short drive. Our room had a microwave and refrigerator which was another plus. This one is a keeper folks.

Reviews.Title: “This place is the greatest value available in the Orlando area”
Reviews.Author: johnpg82
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and the breakfast is great. It really can't get any better but it does because they have free shuttles to and from the park. If you want a nice clean room at a great price you want to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise for the price”
Reviews.Author: supergatorcam
Reviews.Content: stayed here while going to disney world. it's *very* close to the park; less than 10 minutes if there's not much traffic. the room had a microwave and a refrigerator, something we weren't expecting. tasteful decorations in the room; the only downside was the multitude of children running amok at all hours, but the hotel can't be blamed for that, it's just the parents. the free hot breakfast had a waffle maker, 2 kinds of eggs, sausages, cereal, yogurt, bagles, &c. it was delicious. the staff were SUPER nice, greeting us at check in (which was a breeze) and were very attentive, polite, and seemed happy to see us whenever we were in the lobby. we will definately stay here next time we're coming to disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYGUEST5
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 2 nights in this Newly Renovated Property. I have to commend the Hotel Ownership and Management on a job well done. The Hotel Rooms were decorated nicely and we received Clean, Comfortable, and Affordable Accommodations. The Complimentary Breakfast was a nice surprise as well. All in all, any traveller will receive the Best Value for their dollar at this Quality Inn & Suites property.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: umlayallayal
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this Quality Inn Hotel. I cannot even begin to describe the kindness and cooperation of the staff there, especially the hotel manager. Our room was well maintained and the breakfast buffet had a great variety like yogurt, cereal, eggs, muffins, even a waffle maker. The location is excellent too. It's right off highway 192 and is very close to the shopping area and restaurants nearby. We would definitely stay there on our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: kwalker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 weeks in Jan and Feb 2011. Could now have asked for a nicer place. They have newly renovated all the rooms, very clean and unbelievable service. The place looks older when you drive up but don't be fooled. We stayed 2 weeks at a high dollar place down the road that did not compare to here. Will diffidently spend next winter here.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU DON'T STAY HERE, YOU'RE AN IDIOT”
Reviews.Author: WhydahGalley
Reviews.Content: I have extensive experience with the hotels and business in this area and I cannot promote and praise this hotel enough. It is one of those places that must be experienced to be appreciated. As I write this, this Qualiy Inn is less than 1 year old. It is a franchise (privately owned hotel - not a corporate hotel). It was previously a Masters Inn. As a Masters Inn, this was a wonderful hotel and an annual destination for us. When we came to stay last February, the new Quality Inn was not yet officially opened and was still under renovations, but when we told them that we come here every year the wonderful new owners invited us to stay in one of the recently completed rooms for a stunningly low rate. The room was nothing less than beautiful. Well, we came back again this year, the hotel is fully open, and it was simply magnificent. EVERYTHING was new - carpets, beds (with beautiful dark wood headboards), expensive looking dark wood nightstands, a table desk, and a large dresser with built in microwave and refridgerator. It's freshly painted inside and outside in very tasteful colors. Rooms have coffeemaker, iron & ironing board, LOTS of hangers and a rack to hang your clothes, a very comfortable office chair, several lamps and lights, new air conditioning, new TVs, some rooms have computers but WIFI is available and there are computers for use in the lobby as well. The pool area is spotless and lovely, several brand new vending machines can be found throughout the complex, parking surrounds the complex in a way that you are certain to be able to park near your door. The beautifully decorated and furnished lobby also doubles as a lounge and breakfast area - and not just with your old fashioned continental breakfast but a free buffet with eggs, sausage, bacon, waffles, ceral, milk and juices, pasteries, coffees and teas (and much more which I never got around to seeing, being too busy eating my yummy bacon). The staff is absolutely delightful and kind, and the owners nearly fall over themselves and bend over backwards to be of service to you. If you have any problems with them - I can assure you that the problem is yours, not theirs. Taking out any frustration on them would be quite cruel - as has been attested to by nearly everyone else who has posted here. In fact, to demonstrate their generousity... because we had returned to their hotel, the owners gave us an unbelievable discount! And let me tell you - their regular prices are a STEAL!!! I see someone posting here complained that they were charged $60. OMG... what the heck is WRONG with those people to complain about that price?!! Let me tell you all this... my spouse has been a Cape Cod five-star resort hotel manager for nearly 30 years, and you must believe me when I say freom experience that this hotel is worth DOUBLE that price! $60 is NOTHING. However, I do believe that this price is probably their high season price, so you can expect not to pay even that all the time. Talk to the owners in person and you may even be able to "haggle a little with them. There is a reason that this hotel, as of the writing of this review, has been rated #9 out of 183 Kissimmee hotels: IT'S THAT GOOD. The bottom floor rooms are wonderful, but for a really great experience try to get a 2nd or 3rd floor room. There are tons of shops, restaurants and even attractions up and down the road, and the West Gate to Disney World is just down the block. The hotel offers shuttle services to all of the parks. The managment are truly sweet people and they WANT you to have a good time and be happy here. They aren't a big corporation, but rather they treat you like your are guests in their home, and you should behave as such. If you chose to stay at this hotel (which you should), I suggest introducing yourself to one of owners or managers and let them know why you chose their hotel, and get that person's name. And when you leave, don't just drop off your key at the front desk and split, but ask to talk to that person again and TELL HIM/HER about your experience there and let them know if you would return again and if you would recommend them to others. They will sincerely APPRECIATE it. We have been treated with such great care on each of our visits here that we very much feel like family now, and we will continue to make this our stop in Kissimmee/Orlando/Disney. Believe me when I say that, if you do not stay here, you are truly an idiot.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Prash_desh
Reviews.Content: Thanks to tripadvisor, I knew this hotel had a positive response from many people and I decided to try it out. Boy, am I glad I did that !!! This hotel seemed like heaven as compared to the earlier dump I had stayed for the first half of my vacation. Rooms are large, newly renovated and very clean. The furniture was exquisite and one would be really impressed after just opening the lock to his room door. Location of the hotel is perfect for Disney and not too far (if you have rental car) for Universal/Seaworld. Many restaurants are in the vicinity. I didnt try their shuttle service as I wanted flexibility in timings due to my infant kid. Breakfast was good with lots of variety and though it was the same for 3 days I stayed there, I wasn't bored of it. You should certainly give this hotel a try whenever you plan to visit Orlando !!

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: Mat_Toe
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. This hotel is the perfect base for exploring the amusement parks in orlando. The room was great, and so was the staff. Never used the pool because it was too chilly, but it looked nice and clean. As Europeans we were a bit shocked by the plastic tableware at breakfast, but the food itself was very nice and allowed us to skip lunch without feeling hungry and thus we saved a lot of money in the parks. They even provide a complimentary shuttle to the parks directly from/to the hotel. By car it takes about 30 minutes to Universal/Seaworld and about 15 minutes to the Disney parks. We can absolutely recommend this place for your the park trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: racechick8293
Reviews.Content: Taking into consideration the proliferation of lodging along 192 near Disney, I'm not sure that this motel was worth the $60/night plus taxes, fees, etc. that I paid. In an area known for inexpensive lodging and deals that can be obtained in this area, this motel felt overpriced to me. The room was nice, and the location of the motel was good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly staff, Good location, Quiet, Comfortable beds, Safe”
Reviews.Author: MrT69
Reviews.Content: If you need a reasonably price venue to lay your head, this is it. No frills just a clean comfortable room to lay your head. Morning breakfast was well done and the staff worked diligently to ensure supplies were adequate. Front desk staff were extremely polite and efficient. Rooms are not large nor luxuriois but all I care about in Orlando is a clean comfortable place to lay my head and shower before tearing up the parks yet another day

Reviews.Title: “Best Bargain in Florida”
Reviews.Author: dr_wilder
Reviews.Content: After Business in Stuart, Florida I had one day to see some things in Orlando. I booked this hotel on-line and my wife was upset because it was only $50.00 in a great area of Orlando. This seemed to portend a poor hotel, but to our delight it had been recently renovated and was excellent. The owner explained that he just bought it and after renovating everything was keeping the price low to reintroduce it. The service was excellent too. Take advantage of this great price while it lasts. It is worth the price when it goes up but is a great price now.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: sandraflowne
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed here after the Christmas holidays and had a great time! I was taking her to Disney World Magic Kingdom for her 5th birthday and wanted somewhere close by with a shuttle that was affordable. Check in was very quick, the staff at the front desk were exceedingly polite, and upon check-in we found out that we had been upgraded from a regular king room to a king suite, because the room type we booked online were all full. The suite was very large and spacious, had a couch & tv, with a separate area with a very comfy king bed and flat screen tv. It also had a dining area with fridge & microwave, and a nice desk with computer. The bathroom was a standard hotel bathroom, but it was very clean and that is all I am looking for. From our windows you could see the pool, which looked very inviting, however, it was REALLY cold, so we didn't get to go swimming. They have a nice free breakfast with your usual continental fare, toast, muffins, a variety of cereal, yogurt, a waffle maker, scrambled eggs, and sausage, as well as different juices & coffee. I would suggest you get there earlier rather than later, as we went down around 9 (I believe it was served from 6:30-9:30 AM) and there were a lot of people down there, and there was not a lot of seating. The shuttle service was nice, so that we didn't have to worry about parking, but the shuttle service is shared with a few other hotels, so it was sometimes crowded. We had a wonderful time at Magic Kingdom, of course, and after a full day there, it was nice to come back to a comfy king bed and rest. The hotel is also situated very close to a lot of different restaraunts as well as a few stores, in case you need to pick up any misc. items (my daughter's camera batteries died, and we had to get a screwdriver and batteries). We had an excellent time and we will definitely be staying there again next time we go to WDW!

Reviews.Title: “Superb! Best value, leaves you money for the parks!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_teacher23
Reviews.Content: My other half and I decided to go to Orlando for New Years. We secured a great deal through Expedia on this hotel and were concerned that because we'd paid so little for 7 nights, we'd compromised on quality. However.... It was superb, comfy, the room was big and had everything we needed. (Fridge, TV, free wireless, tea/coffee facilities, bathroom etc) It's a motel style hotel with ample parking and we couldn't believe that included in the price was breakfast. The beds were really great to sleep on, although the aircon was a bit loud at times. Breakfast was great, including everything from cooked food to waffles, to pastries, cereal, juice etc. The pool looked really inviting, although it wasn't warm enough when we were there to try it. There are several restaurants and supermarkets nearby so you don't have to pay the theme park prices to get a meal. Within a stones throw are Indian, Steak and Mexican restaurants. A petrol station is nearby too. Amazingly, you can also get a free shuttle to Epcot and Universal. There aren't hundreds but , again it saves dollars ($14 per day in Disney and Universal parks) We were there to do the parks and this hotel enabled us to afford it. It took about 10 mins to Disney and 15 min drive to Universal. We also went to the Kennedy Space Centre and the drive was a little over an hour. We would definitely stay again and would recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Find - Thanks, TripAdivsor!”
Reviews.Author: TrippinLady
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on TripAdvisor when I realized that we needed an affordable place to stay after our trip to Disney. I needed something pretty close to the parks since we were going to be getting there late. The staff was very helpful, friendly and courteous. The rooms were very clean. New bedding, new mattresses, freshly painted walls, large room and clean! We were up early to head down to the hot breakfast that was served: sausage, biscuits, fruit, waffles, pastries, eggs. We were pleasantly surprised! Lots of seating too! There was a computer available for us to jump on and get information on our next destination. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sunshine02008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we had problems at another local hotel and were looking for an alternative that was close to Disney and reasonably priced. This place is fantastic. It is family owned - and maybe that makes all of the difference. They REALLY care! When I called on the phone to book the reservation, Jim was friendly and did his best to get us the rooms we wanted. He was very helpful at check-in and told us about the free hot breakfast in the morning and to let him know if we needed anything. One of the rooms had a key that wouldn't work right away and he came over immediately. The rooms are newly renovated and look brand new. The beds are very comfortable. Everything was super clean. The only thing I would have liked was a refrigerator in the room - he said they are hoping to get them in all of the rooms in the future - right now they are available in certain rooms for an additional fee. (It's been a long time since I've been in a hotel room that didn't have a fridge in it - I thought it was a little odd). Breakfast in the morning was pretty good - make your own waffles and hot sausage and eggs, plus the usual continental breakfast fare. We will definitely stay here again - the best service ever - and a wonderful night's rest in a comfortable spotless room.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Glovehawk
Reviews.Content: I paid $60 each for 3 rooms for 1 night because our timeshare was not ready. What a deal! The place was just remodeled, repainted, and refurnished mid-summer, 2010. All new everything! Very convenient to the parks, restaurants, airport, etc. To top it off, they provided an excellent breakfast in their remodeled lobby. For what was provided it would have cost me at least $10 per person at a restaurant. Management & staff was courteous too. You won't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: ivymcd
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated and still working on making it the best hotel in the area. The owners Jim and Mike can't do enough for you. The atmosphere is quiet, pleasant, clean, welcoming and friendly. The location to WDW is perfect. Close to various restaurants, shopping and entertainment.. The pool is small but clean.A continental breakfast is included in your nightly rate. It should be rated at least 3 stars. If they keep up the vision they have for the hotel it won't be long before it is. Great place. I would recommend it to anyone and would definitely return. THE MCDONALD FAMILY CANADA

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel you will experience”
Reviews.Author: ceejay00
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this location previously (Masters Inn),my family and i called in on our arrival in Kissimmee.We were greeted by a most courteous gentleman who turned out to be the manager and he was very pleased that we had chosen to return.We booked our room and we astonished to see what a transformation they had done.Everywhere was clean and very well appointed, new beds and quality mattresses.After a peaceful and very comfortable nights sleep we went for breakfast in the hotels spacious foyer and had a most enjoyable and better still free breakfast.Whilst my wife and grandson were having their meal I booked us in for the fortnight that we were in Florida.I stay in hotels every week with my work and by far this is the best hotel I have ever stayed at..If you are in the area you could not find a better hotel with very genuine friendly staff,nothing seems to much trouble.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 2945 Entry Point Boulevard, Kissimmee, FL 34747
